text: The National Elk Refuge is a wildlife refuge in Jackson Hole, Wyoming. It was started in 1912 to protect habitat for one of the largest elk (moose) herds. The area is . An average of 7,500 elk live there each winter. U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service manages the refuge. The refuge's elk migrate from as far away as southern Yellowstone National Park. ==Other websites== * National Elk Refuge, United States Fish and Wildlife Service * National Elk Refuge: Refuge Road Wildlife Viewing Guide, U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service Category:Geography of Wyoming
title: National Elk Refuge
